### Discrete exponential growth 

```{r eruptions, echo=FALSE}
sidebarLayout(
  sidebarPanel(
    # User defined lambda -------
    sliderInput("lambda", label = "Population growth rate (lambda):",
                min = 0.01, max = 2, value = 1.01, step = .01),
    # User defined N0 -------
    numericInput("N0", label = "Initial population size (N0)",
                min = 1, max = 100, value = 1, step = 1),
    # User defined time ---------
    numericInput("time", label = "Number of time steps to project",
                min = 1, max = 1000, value = 100, step = 1)
    ),

  # Panel of plots -----
  mainPanel(
    renderPlot({plots_to_print()}, width = 450, height = 450)
  )
)

# Generate trajectories for sp 1 --------
exponential_pop_traj <- reactive({discrete_exponential(N0 = input$N0, 
                                                       lambda = input$lambda,
                                                       time = input$time)})
exponential_pop_df <- reactive({data.frame(time = 0:input$time,
                                 N_t= exponential_pop_traj(),
                                 popdiff = c(NA, diff(exponential_pop_traj())),
                                 Ntm1 = c(lag(exponential_pop_traj())),
                                 popratio = exponential_pop_traj()/lag(exponential_pop_traj()))})


# Make plot -----------
trajaectory_plot <- reactive({ggplot(data.frame(exponential_pop_df())) +
  geom_line(aes(y = N_t, x = time), size = .2) +
    geom_point(aes(y = N_t, x = time), size = .2, shape = 21,
               fill = "white", stroke = .8) +
    ylab(latex2exp::TeX("Population size at time $t$ ($N_t$)"))})

# Make a list of plots and print out plots based on which ones were requested ----

plots_to_print <- reactive({trajaectory_plot()})


```

### Discrete logistic

```{r ab, echo=FALSE}
sidebarLayout(
  sidebarPanel(
    # User defined lambda -------
    sliderInput("rd", label = "Population growth rate (rd):",
                min = 0.01, max = 3, value = 1.01, step = .01),
    # User defined N0 -------
    numericInput("N0_2", label = "Initial population size (N0)",
                min = 1, max = 100, value = 1, step = 1),
    # User defined time ---------
    numericInput("time_2", label = "Number of time steps to project",
                min = 1, max = 1000, value = 100, step = 1),
    # User defined carrying capacity (K) ----------    
    numericInput("K", label = "Carrying capacity",
                 min = 1, max = 1000, value = 100, step = 1)

    ),

  # Panel of plots -----
  mainPanel(
    renderPlot({plots_to_print2()}, width = 450, height = 450)
  )
)

# Get user defined parameters for discrete logistic  ------
discrete_pop_traj <- reactive({discrete_logistic(N0 = input$N0_2, K = input$K, rd = input$rd, time = input$time_2)})
dlog_df <- reactive({data.frame(Nt = discrete_pop_traj(),
                      time = 1:input$time_2)})

# Generate trajectories for discrete logistic --------
trajaectory_plot2 <- reactive({ggplot(dlog_df()) +
  geom_line(aes(x = time, y = Nt), size = .2) +
  geom_point(aes(x = time, y = Nt), size = 1.5, shape = 21,
             fill = "white", stroke = .8 )})
# Make plots -----------

# 0. Make caption  ------

# 1. Trajectory of N vs. time -----------

# 2. Trjectory of ln(N) vs. time --------

# 3. dN/dT vs. N -----------

# 4. dN/Ndt vs. N -----------

# Make a list of plots and print out plots based on which ones were requested ----

plots_to_print2 <- reactive({trajaectory_plot2()})


```
